options.value: चीन से अन्य देशों में रेशमी वस्त्र ले जाने वाले व्यापारियों का यात्रा मार्ग।
समुद्री मार्ग जो उन देशों को जोड़ते थे जहाँ रेशमी वस्त्रों के व्यापारी अपने उत्पाद बेचते&nbsp;थे।&nbsp;
उन सभी देशों को जोड़ने वाली सड़कें जहां शहतूत के पौधों की खेती की जाती थी।<br />
सड़क, समुद्र और वायु मार्ग जहाँ रेशमी उत्पादों का व्यापार होता था।

ta.value: பண்டைய காலத்தில் "பட்டுப் பாதை" என்ற சொல் எதைக் குறிக்கிறது?

options.value: சீனாவில் இருந்து மற்ற நாடுகளுக்கு வணிகர்கள் பட்டு சுமந்து செல்லும் பாதை.
பட்டு வியாபாரிகள் தங்கள் பொருட்களை விற்ற நாடுகளை இணைக்கும் கடல் வழிகள்.
மல்பெரி செடிகள் பயிரிடப்பட்ட அனைத்து நாடுகளையும் இணைக்கும் சாலைகள்.
பட்டு பொருட்கள் வர்த்தகம் செய்யப்பட்ட சாலை மற்றும் கடல் வழிகள்.

en.value: To keep ice-cream soft and creamy ________ is/are added to it.
en.comp:
Read the passage given below and answer the questions/complete the statement that follows by choosing the correct options out of the given ones.

While ice-cream is made, the manufacturers freeze the base quickly, while constantly stirring to prevent large crystals from forming. Once the ice-cream is made, the next worry is maintaining its quality during storage, ensuring that the crystals don't grow and that the creamy texture stays. This is why mass-manufactured ice-creams often contain stabilizers and emulsifiers, aside from the basics of milk, cream, sugar and flavouring.

Emulsifiers can come from a natural source such as egg yolk or butter milk, or they can be chemically extracted too. Whatever the source, these emulsifiers are used to prevent fat globules in the ice-cream from combining and rising to the top over time. They coat the fat globules and keep the fat and whipped air well-distributed through the ice-cream.

Stabilisers such as guar gum, locust bean gum etc. are often added to increase viscosity and prevent ice crystals from becoming larger during temperature fluctuations. Most of these gums are derived from plants.

For those who would like to avoid the stabilisers - ice-cream expert lovers are not fans of the slightly chewy texture it creates; other consumers worry about what is in a stabiliser - there are premium variants that come without, though they do have almost double the butterfat content.

For those who would like to avoid the sugar. there are sugar-free-ice-creams too. but they are not as creamy. Sugar lowers the freezing point of a mixture. In ice-cream. this helps keep parts of the ice-cream in the liquid phase at freezer temperature. making it easier to scoop and smoother on the tongue.

Some manufacturers replace butterfat with non-dairy fats. either to cut costs or to appeal to vegans. These products are tagged 'frozen desserts'. not ice-creams. Coconut milk and cashew cream frozen desserts can be quite good: those made using cheap refined vegetable oils are typically not.

In ice-cream. this helps keep parts of the ice-cream in the liquid phase at freezer temperature. making it easier to scoop and smoother on the tongue.

Some manufacturers replace butterfat with non-dairy fats. either to cut costs or to appeal to vegans. These products are tagged 'frozen desserts'. not ice-creams. Coconut milk and cashew cream frozen desserts can be quite good: those made using cheap refined vegetable oils are typically not.

en.value: Choose the option which is <u><strong>NOT</strong></u> correct from among the&nbsp;&nbsp;following.
en.comp:
Read the passage given below and answer the questions/complete the statement that follows by choosing the correct options out of the given ones.

While ice-cream is made, the manufacturers freeze the base quickly, while constantly stirring to prevent large crystals from forming. Once the ice-cream is made, the next worry is maintaining its quality during storage, ensuring that the crystals don't grow and that the creamy texture stays. This is why mass-manufactured ice-creams often contain stabilizers and emulsifiers, aside from the basics of milk, cream, sugar and flavouring.

Emulsifiers can come from a natural source such as egg yolk or butter milk, or they can be chemically extracted too. Whatever the source, these emulsifiers are used to prevent fat globules in the ice-cream from combining and rising to the top over time. They coat the fat globules and keep the fat and whipped air well-distributed through the ice-cream.

Stabilisers such as guar gum, locust bean gum etc. are often added to increase viscosity and prevent ice crystals from becoming larger during temperature fluctuations. Most of these gums are derived from plants.

For those who would like to avoid the stabilisers - ice-cream expert lovers are not fans of the slightly chewy texture it creates; other consumers worry about what is in a stabiliser - there are premium variants that come without, though they do have almost double the butterfat content.

For those who would like to avoid the sugar. there are sugar-free-ice-creams too. but they are not as creamy. Sugar lowers the freezing point of a mixture. In ice-cream. this helps keep parts of the ice-cream in the liquid phase at freezer temperature. making it easier to scoop and smoother on the tongue.

Some manufacturers replace butterfat with non-dairy fats. either to cut costs or to appeal to vegans. These products are tagged 'frozen desserts'. not ice-creams. Coconut milk and cashew cream frozen desserts can be quite good: those made using cheap refined vegetable oils are typically not.

en.value: What/who is &#39;I&#39; in these lines?
en.comp:
Read the stanzas given below and answer the questions/complete the statements then follow by choosing the correct options out of the given ones.

Three year she grew in sun and shower,

Then Nature said, 'A lovelier flower

On earth was never sown:

This child I to myself will take:

She shall be mine, and I will make

A lady of my own.

Myself will to my darling be

Both law and impulse: and with me

The girl, in rock and plain,

In earth and heaven, in glade and bower,

Shall feel on overseeing power

To kindle or restrain.

en.value: <span style="">Who is called the &#39;Father of Milk Revolution&#39;?</span>
en.comp:
Read the passage give below and answer the question/complete the statements that follow by choosing the correct options out of the given ones.

Thanks to Dr Kurien’s endeavours, by and large, Anand Milk Union Limited, has emerged as the biggest name today. But, the real contribution of the 'Father of the White Revolution' lies in the empowerment of the poor and in initiating constructive social change in rural areas. This milk revolution today directly benfits about 10 million dairy farmers.

In the 1980s, he replicated the milk revolution in, the sphere of edible oils with 'Operation Golden Flow'. At Anand, Dr Kurien has established one of the finest dairies in Asia, producing whole and skimmed milk powder from the milk of buffaloes. The butter and cheese produced here are the best sellers in elite markets. Teams of professional in dairy and animal husbandry from several countries have visited Anand to learn from India.

The man behind the 'White Revolution' has been Dr Verghese Kurien, the visionary administrator who spearheaded the dairy cooperative movement and made 'Operation Flood' a runaway success. By building India's dairy industry, he has achieved recognition for himself and brought glory to the country. He successfully managed to bring India ahead of all other countries, as the world's largest milk producing country. Today, he occupies a unique position of leadership in the dairy industry and has also been recognised as a prominent dairy expert, internationally.

en.value: The brother addressed this letter to Sathya at his office as:
en.comp:
Read the passage given below and answer the questions/complete the statements that follow by choosing the correct options out of the given ones.

His brother's letter reached him addressed to his office. He had not written home ever since he came Malgudi. The brother wrote:

“I am very pleased to know about your whereabouts through your paper, the first issue of which you have been good enough to send me. I have read the explanations you have given in your first editorial, but don't you think that you have set yourself an all too ambitious task? Don't you have to give some more reading for the four annas you are demanding? As it is, the magazine is over too quickly and we have to wait for a whole week again. And then, will you allow me this criticism? You are showing yourself to be an aggressive fellow. Almost every line of your paper is an attack on something.
